The LINE Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 133 reviews

Stayed from June 23-June 26. check in was smooth was able to check in early (a little after 12:00pm).

the room is clean and neat, i was in unit 801 king suite facing the Hollywood sign, so i was at the end of the hall was not noisy at all. I like the feature of the automatic shades in case you for get to let them down or up in the morning and at night. hotel only has valet parking and is about $32 + tax so about $37 dollars a day... there is other parking around but I went on this trip solo so i just parked at the hotel. Room service was great but pretty pricey. ordered eggs, hashbrowns and bacon with OJ for $25 but when i got the bill there was an extra $10 in fees and taxes.... Ihop and Denny's are not far, actually in walking distance from the hotel. overall hotel services were great helpful staff and if don't want 3 to 4 knocks in the morning from mini bar or house keeping or who ever, put the do not disturb sign out. Also not far from Hollywood Blvd about a 15-20 minute drive depending on traffic. would recommend this property and would stay here again.

Show more
ciera , United States
Los Angeles Adventurer All Suite Hotel
5.6 Review score
Based on 302 reviews

This hotel is a real SHAME on LA hotels. Reception staff (both of them) showed NO RESPECT to customers.

I never met any hotel staff (if they really were HOTEL staff) eating nuts and biscuits when serving customers. I have waited for 30 minutes before they told me the further room information. It takes some time to process my booking NOT because there are many customers or booking issue but because they are busy chatting with friends (in person or phone) AND looking for snacks to eat. Yes SNACKS like candies, biscuits, nuts etc. They are chewing their lovely snacks when talking with me. I do not sense even a little respect from their tones and wordings. My room has two beds. It is okay spacious but the table is messy with a bottles of wine and snacks. I have to clean it up MYSELF before I can find a little room to put my things. As I and my wife would like to go to Universal Studio, we asked the receptionist how we can take public transport to it but the lady showed a black face and not willing to tell us. They just point to a "Tour" brochure and asked us to read it ourselves - what a GOOD service! After two nights stay, finally we can leave this horrible hotel. However the nightmare hasn't ended... We are expecting a shuttle bus to drive us to the airport and the receptionist told us that it will arrive in 25 minutes. So we wait and wait.... the shuttle bus never arrived even after ONE HOUR. As we can't wait forever so we decided to take the local bus and go to LAX airport ourselves. Luckily we can catch the flight otherwise we have to buy another air ticket. I sincerely suggest other tourists DO NOT book this hotel even the price is cheaper. You will get EXTREMELY bad service. It just doesn't worth it.

Show more
Tsz , Hong Kong
Sheraton Park Hotel at the Anaheim Resort
7.7 Very good
Based on 32 reviews

We stayed for 3 days on the club level, facing the swimming pool. The location was great as it was within walking distance to the parks.

The front desk were not helpful and friendly. The hotel was badly in need of a major renovation. It was old, run down and tired. However, the bed was really comfortable. The lift was really old and slow. Breakfast at the Club Lounge was limited and on the third day, we pretty much got tired of having breakfast there and chose to have it elsewhere. We will definitely not return to this hotel in the future.

Show more
Jashida , Singapore
Hotel Normandie Los Angeles
8 Very good
Based on 80 reviews

Pro: + Ricky did a great job welcoming us. 10/10 for his part. + USB charger + Location is great + Valet parking is easy (to improve, there should be someone driving the car from the hotel front door to the parking facility, instead of having us driving all the way to the other side) $22 is slightly pricy, perhaps $15 is more fair + Lobby looks amazing + House keeping staff did a great job + Spacious Wardrobe + Cable TV showing ESPN TNT etc.

+ safe neighbourhood Con: - Heritage building as expected, you can smell it from the decor in room. - The free breakfast, you can forget about it. I rather they charge us $15 each for a better breakfast. The free breakfast is like soup kitchen. - Toilet is small, and the toilet itself is way too close to the door - Odor - Noise from the street (I have asked for a quite room, but then I was facing the intersection) - At least cover the room with carpets or provide slippers - we need kettle coffee and tea in every room - we need a safe - we need a cabinet or a shelf to put out own toiletries items in the bathroom I would probably return to this hotel, due to its location and knowing what to be expected. I am open to try other ones in the area.

Show more
Anderson , Australia
Sheraton Grand Los Angeles
8 Very good
Based on 60 reviews

We had a very pleasant stay at the Sheraton Downtown Los Angeles. Best treat was the deal we got from Agoda for rooms located at the Lounge floor.

We got access to the Club Lounge where we had breakfast everyday and snacks, too, when we get to the hotel early fromt he conference. And yes, the club lounge experience came with free wifi, so we nejoyed fast, reliable internet connection the whole time. We'll definitely recommend this hotel to peers during business conferences.

Show more
Paolo , Philippines
Hilton Los Angeles Airport
7.7 Very good
Based on 393 reviews

i really appreciated my stay at this hilton- it was brief but they did everything right. the hotel is located on the main drag to lax, and was easy to find and get to.

parking is a bit pricey, but you've got to expect that due to the airport. the rooms were clean and well appointed. mine was surprisingly quiet. the bathroom was a bit small, but i really don't have a need for a big bathroom so i can't complain. there is a hilton honors lounge on the top floor that was well appointed.

Show more
XIN , Singapore
The BLVD Hotel & Spa
7.8 Very good
Based on 88 reviews

I was greeted with sulky faces to begin with. Then our toilet bowl choked. When we asked for help, they passed us the equipments and told us to do it ourselves.

We asked to change rooms which they agreed, without so much as offer assistance to help us move. I called the reception to voice out my dissatifaction, telling them that I did not even fix my own plumbing back home let alone PAY to come and fix THEIR plumbing. Again, the response was a cold, " I understand. But we moved you to a new room right?" I will definitely not recommend this place if you are travelling with children. They will not so much as hold the door for you. The place looks like an in between of a motel and hotel. Definitely not worth the money paid. The rooms were dark and gloomy.

Show more
Kho , Singapore
The Mayfair Hotel
6.2 Good
Based on 312 reviews

Possitive Feedback: Very friendly staff during the day but not so friendly staff at night. Negative Feedback: Historic Mayfair Hotel is located on West 7th Street downtown LA.

It is a major concern for any tourists to wonder around at night. It is ok during the day but when night falls, it is scary and feel unsafe to walk around the neighbourhood. Lots of street people living around the area. All downtown LA are not too safe to wonder around at night and not recommend any tourist to stay in downtown LA. High risk area. Security is a major concern especially at night. Encountered night shift staff at front desk reception had tendency of not picking up phone call.

Show more
Leng , Australia
Ramada Plaza Hotel LAX - El Segundo
5.2 Review score
Based on 151 reviews

I would not recommend this hotel unless you want to be part of a horror movie. Let me list things why: 1) Parking is terrible.

There is a sign asking hotel guests to park across the street in a residential area which you have to cross a 5 lane busy roadway. 2) WiFi - yes its free but signal strength is so weak the browser ends up timing out. Ended up using our smartphones. 3) Remote for tv was broken, 4) Limited channel selection on TV. 5) Ants all over the bathroom and walls. 6) Hotel ran out of towels. 7) Fitness room was closed - looked like it hadn't been opended for months/years 8) Hallways were dark and not well lit. One light was flickering like in a horror movie. 9) Business Center was a home computer with a credit card reader. 10) Elevator broke down twice. 11) Nothing walkable except for a Denny's restaurant.

Show more
Robert , United States
Hollywood Hotel - The Hotel of Hollywood Near Universal Studios
7.3 Very good
Based on 357 reviews

location hotel is located about 30 minute drive from lax, and around 5-10 drive from chinese theatre.

there's a metro stop close by. some shops, and restaurants near the metro. despite what other reviewers say, the area is fine and did not find it at all dodgy even at night, but as its east hollywood it all seems a bit sketchy first impressions. room the room was adequate overall it was on the ground floor facing the road, but was quiet. it looked a little dated with old furnishings but was clean, tv worked well and the bed was large, quite high but slept comfortably. the bathroom was also dated but amenities were adequate. the water did not seem that hot though, ok for a shower but not for a bath. facilities the hotel has a restaurant in the basement, it has quite nice decor but tv's are on. only used it for breakfast in which there was plenty of options overall. there is an egg station and overall thought the breakfast was ok (stayed in many hotels in the us where the breakfast is just cereal and bread). there is a swimming pool but didn't see it. they have a large car park which is secure with security and gates, it unfortunately cost $20 a day but am told this is standard in la. at least i felt the car was very secure. wifi is free though and works very well. staff staff overall were very nice, especially the reception lady whom helped me understand the controls on my hired mustang. check-in and check out was smooth. staff at breakfast and cleaning also are nice and say hi. bear in mind there is a $100 deposit even though there is no mini bar, apparently for movies etc.. overall the hotel was perfect for sightseeing in the hollywood area and was reasonable for one night. room was ok but breakfast & staff were nice. paying for parking was annoying but wifi was free, comparing to other hotels in the area in which are double the price i would happily come back here.

Show more
Scott , United Kingdom
Super 8 Anaheim Disneyland Drive
7.3 Very good
Based on 18 reviews

Hotel Solaire Los Angeles
6.9 Good
Based on 126 reviews

I came to LA to for a one day business trip. Unfortunately, I booked the room the night before and I could not cancel the booking because there is a 24 hour policy to cancel.

The reason I try to cancel is because the job site got changed to another location and this information was provided to after 30 minutes of the booking and did not exceed the 24 hour notice. Be aware of the booking conditions As for the hotel stay, the neighborhood was not the greatest, a bit run down. There was a backdoor entrance close to the parking lot, but the card slot was not registering and made me walk around the hotel to access the room. The wifi was not working properly and it kept dropping for unknown reasons. All my devices was doing that so it's not the devices. The shower faucet was leaking and making dripping sound, which is not a big deal, but I'm light sleeper. The maintenance was not available and the staff switch me to another room. The biggest issue I had was that other guest was entering and exiting their rooms very late night (3 - 6 AM range) and the sound of the door closing was quite loud and it woke me a couple times so the sound insulation wasn't the greatest. The breakfast was a decent, but it gets a bit crowded in the morning. I can not say anything positive about this experience. Quite unfortunate.

Show more
I-Juinn , Taiwan
Hotel Shangri-La
8.2 Excellent
Based on 95 reviews

I was upgraded to a suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms but I was not very fascinated as I originally booked an ocean view room, but end up upgraded to a large suite without ocean views.

Honestly, for us as a pair of couple such a large suite is not neccessary. The best thing is we can have separate bathrooms to wash in the morning, so we don't need to rush for checking out next morning. At night when we back to the suite we realised that one of the room the air conditioning was broken. Thus, one of the room we actually didn't use it at all. In midnight we realised that we couldn't access the internet. It was actually the morning time in Hong Kong that we would contact with our friends and relative through internet. We called the front desk to help, and the answer was they have passed the case to IT department and "hopefully" they will get it done. End up we couldn't use the internet that night. When I back to Hong Kong I realised that my credit card was being charged around USD4 more than the bill. Though it is not a huge amount but I expect as a 4-5 stars hotel they should somehow sending me an email clarifying when they charged that USD4 more. I wouldn't call them to ask as if I call long distance it costs more than USD4!

Show more
Wai , Hong Kong
Metro Plaza Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 148 reviews

This was my first time visiting L.A. so I wasn't sure what to expect when arriving. When I booked this hotel I liked the fact that it was so close to the metro and within walking distance of lots of museums and other points of interest.

The hotel itself was very lovely, clean, and the staff was very helpful and welcoming. Parking at the hotel is $4 a day which is very good considering city parking prices. Only negative thing I can say is it can be very loud at night because it is so close to main streets which might make sleeping difficult but it wasn't a big deal. Loved my stay here and I would definitely come back again.

Show more
Kristen , United States
Four Points by Sheraton Los Angeles International Airport
7.4 Very good
Based on 254 reviews

I am a frequent traveler so I know what to expect as standard. There is nothing terrible about hotel however for the money, you can do much better booking elsewhere.

I checked in and the receptionist explained that every hotel in LAS charged $20 a night for parking and they provided a bottle of free water and free internet, I reminded her that this is standard in nearly all hotels and they did not charge for parking and a lot give you free breakfast. Going to the room it is obvious the hotel is very tired and worn and clear signs they are milking this property to the max, before they refurbish it. The rooms are located behind a corridor so there is no windows directly to the outside. There is just a flimsy wall with a glass pane in it, to the corridor, that when other guests walk or enter their rooms, the whole wall rattles! I was woke up several times by other guests entering their rooms during the night. On entering the room the shock was the centrepiece of the room was a big white fridge! No cupboard to hide it in, it was there, in all its glory. Well if I wanted to sleep in a kitchen, I would have booked a room! Unbelievable So far I could put up with the worn out property however the breaking point was the internet! Good internet is a standard expectation in every hotel today, however this hotel takes you back to dial up speeds. I went down stairs and the Manager told me 'yes the internet is really bad and really old, it was not designed for the use it gets today, we do not have enough routers, we have been talking of upgrading for a while now" Really! I was delighted they had discussed this but this was totally unacceptable. The very basic requirement is for a hotel to provide good internet to guests. I was ended up working in the foray at 11pm at night to get a better signal. It was surreal.

Show more
Martin , United Kingdom
Desert Palms Hotel & Suites
8.7 Excellent
Based on 15 reviews

The London West Hollywood at Beverly Hills
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 14 reviews

Hyatt Regency Los Angeles International Airport
8.4 Excellent
Based on 54 reviews

I've never been more disappointed in a hotel than this one. I stay almost 250 days a year in hotels around the world for business and pleasure, so I have experience with the hospitality industry.

I booked online and paid extra for a king bed. Arrived and checked in at 10:00pm after flying for 5.5 hours and nothing was mentioned that the room would be different from what I paid for. Arrived to the room with 2 double beds. I immediately called the front desk and they told me that the hotel was sold out and since I booked on a 3rd party website, there were no guarantees of getting the room I paid for. Really?? After 45 minutes and 3 calls back to the front desk, I told them that if I did not receive the room I paid for, then place me in a like property nearby with a king sized bed. 15 minutes later, they "found" a king room on the same floor as where I was placed originally. I thought my problems were solved:) There was no shampoo in the room, it took three calls to the front desk and 35 minutes before finally some shampoo arrived. It's now midnight and I have an international flight in the morning. 7:00am I call for a bellhop and car to be brought up. I waited 35 minutes for the bellhop. I was walking out of the room to go check out when the bellman arrived. I check out and was never told about any extra parking and valet fees at the front desk. My folio has no charges of any kind. No bellhop in sight, I pushed the cart out to my car and was approach by the valet. They didn't offer to help with my 3 large suitcases and 2 heavy carry ons and other bags, but as I was loading my own car to head to the airport, the valet said I needed to pay $40 cash for the parking and valet before releasing my keys. I told her that I've already checked out, I'm late for my flight since the bellman took 35 minutes and I'm not going to pay cash for parking especially since the valet didn't even offer to help load my car beforehand. The keys were on the counter. I grab

Show more
James , United States
Ramada Burbank Airport
6.9 Good
Based on 62 reviews

I wasn't sure about this hotel after reading some of the reviews but my fiancé talked me into staying there.

I was there for 4 nights and the only problem I had was the handle on the toilet broke off and when I told the front desk about it they gave me a new room right away. I didn't have any problems with the new room. The rooms are clean and smell fine. Staff took care of problem right away. The only complaint I would have is that the walls aren't sound proof and if your neighbors are noisy enough you can hear them. But if you can get past that then it's worth staying there. I'll definitely stay there again.

Show more
Jason , United States
Baymont Inn & Suites - LAX-Lawndale
7.3 Very good
Based on 497 reviews

I say it's probably not your average review because it seems like this hotel mostly has pretty good reviews.

We arrived at the hotel around 11pm Saturday night after a long day of traveling to check in. There were quite a few people checking in as well, which wasn't a big deal. However, it was impossible to find parking, as there were not enough spots to accommodate a full, or even mostly full, hotel. We get to our room only to find that the bathroom is locked from the inside... aka we have no bathroom. We call down to the front desk and the gal, who was the only one working in the entire hotel, suggests using a credit card or something to pick the lock because her maintenance guy that was supposed to be there did not show up. After trying unsuccessfully to pick the lock, the front desk gal brings up the tool they use to pick the lock (because this is clearly a recurring problem) and is also unsuccessful. Since the hotel was completely sold out, she's unable to offer us another room so she suggests that we use the bathroom in the lobby until the morning when a different maintenance guy shows up or she can move us to another room. (I do want to note that the employee who helped us that night did the best she could with what she had to work with and I, in no way, blame her for anything that happened.) On the second to last day, we tried to enter our room and our key cards had been deactiviated. The employee working stated this may have been because they was near a cell phone or something. That doesn't make sense though because the key cards were also used to activate the elevator and did so just fine. Just didn't work for our room. All that to say, we did end up staying at the hotel for the rest of our stay but will never be back to this Baymont Inn or any other one.

Show more
Nicole , United States
Century Park Hotel LA
7.1 Very good
Based on 14 reviews

Sofitel Los Angeles Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 113 reviews

Sofitel Los Angeles is more like a business hotel, it is of a 4 to 5-star standard. The main lobby may be small but looks class.

Staff are polite and friendly and offer to upgrade us to their suite room. The surrounding area of the hotel is clean and neat. The room is of standard size, it will be too small for more than 3 person. Toilet is clean and toiletries and special items such as shower cap, cotton buds, nail file are provided. Bed is extremely comfortable. Beverly Center is just located opposite the hotel which house many branded stores like Prada, LV, Forever 21, Macy etc. We love this hotel very much and thank you for all yours reviews for this hotel.

Gerald , Singapore

Fletcher ,United States

I lived in Los Angeles from 1981 to 2008, so there isn't much about the city that is intimidating to me.

However to the traveler that has never been to a mega-city, it can be overwhelming, intimidating and difficult to get around. The freeways all stop n go from 6a-8p everday except Sunday. The rail system would be a good option. and if you have a rental car.....use your smart phone as a gps and always ALWAYS use streets to get around between downtown LA, Hollywood, beaches, etc. Remember Sunset Blvd goes from downtown out to Santa Monica and the beaches and pier. The Getty Museum (a must see...make reservations) is just off Sunset. Once you are at the beaches, you can take Pacific Coast Highway up and down the coastal area. Definite recommend. Getting around will definitely be frustrating, so leave yourself an extra 60 minutes if you have a place you want to be at a specific time.

More about Los Angeles (CA)

Los Angeles is arguably one of the most popular cities in the world, eclipsing most other cities on the west coast of the United States. The city is surrounded by mountains and the expansive Pacific Ocean, giving the city a unique natural beauty.

The diversity of Los Angeles goes far beyond the communities that flaunt the cultures of the many people who call the city home. One such cultural community is Chinatown, where travelers can experience a uniquely Californian version of the community.

Accommodations around Los Angeles are readily available and range in prices to fit most budgets. Los Angeles has several attractions, the least of which being the magnetic draw of Hollywood. Even the Hollywood Sign enjoys a prominent place on the itineraries of most travelers to this city. Of course Hollywood itself is a must-see for visitors to this city, but those more interested in the city’s more natural charms might find the coastlines, many national parks, and places like Venice Beach more exciting.

Los Angeles has the second-biggest metropolitan area in the United States, with neighborhoods such as Korea Town and West Hollywood providing some of the most exciting nightlife and entertainment.

Los Angeles International Airportis a very busy hub for travelers coming to the United States. The area is home to many accommodations, as well as the upscale community of Manhattan Beach.

Los Angeles is one of the most famous cities in the world, and the interactive map on this page is the perfect gateway to exploring more of this vibrant metropolis.

Tea, coffee with some muffins and packed cereal. We love the location of the hotel - right behind the Hollywood and Highland. Public transport from HH was convenient. Getting to the hotel from the airport was a bit more difficult as the cab driver wasn't familiar with the hotel. The hotel was great value for money. highly recommended for tourists who don't want to spend too much money on a room that they are hardly spending any time in. And when you do spend time in the room, it is a really decent room. Our room was huge. Had a sitting area, a small dining table, fridge, a separate dressing area and bathroom. We had 4 huge bags that we placed very comfortably in the room. The city is surrounded by mountains and the expansive Pacific Ocean, giving the city a unique natural beauty. The diversity of Los Angeles goes far beyond the communities that flaunt the cultures of the many people who call the city home. One such cultural community is Chinatown , where travelers can experience a uniquely Californian version of the community. Accommodations around Los Angeles are readily available and range in prices to fit most budgets. Los Angeles has several attractions, the least of which being the magnetic draw of Hollywood. Even the Hollywood Sign enjoys a prominent place on the itineraries of most travelers to this city. Of course Hollywood itself is a must-see for visitors to this city, but those more interested in the city’s more natural charms might find the coastlines, many national parks, and places like Venice Beach more exciting. Los Angeles has the second-biggest metropolitan area in the United States, with neighborhoods such as Korea Town and West Hollywood providing some of the most exciting nightlife and entertainment. Los Angeles International Airport is a very busy hub for travelers coming to the United States. The area is home to many accommodations, as well as the upscale community of Manhattan Beach. Los Angeles is one of the most famous cities in the world, and the interactive map on this page is the perfect gateway to exploring more of this vibrant metropolis.
